intro: Echites andrieuxii, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of five-petaled flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, fleshy fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
